hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Customer_Analyzer v2: Add automatic alignment check for segment definition + messaging version on sync.docx

sections.text:
This feature adds an automatic “alignment check” during the Sales_Accelerator → Customer_Analyzer v2 sync to ensure each synced account/opportunity is using the currently active/expected segment definition ID and messaging version. Today, outdated segment definitions or messaging can silently propagate, creating inconsistency between what teams believe is “approved” and what the system is actually using.

On each sync, the backend will compare the record’s segment definition and messaging version against the active configuration. If either value is out of date, the system will mark the record with an `alignment_failed` status and emit a non-blocking warning entry in integration logs. Sync will continue (no hard failure), but the mismatch becomes visible and traceable for follow-up and remediation.

The primary impact is improved data integrity and operational control: teams can quickly identify which accounts/opportunities are misaligned before that misalignment impacts downstream analysis, reporting, or message drafting. It also reduces the support burden and time spent diagnosing “why does this customer have old messaging/segmenting?” by making misalignment explicit and persisted.

This ticket is intentionally scoped to detection + status recording only. It lays the foundation for subsequent work that will use the persisted status to drive UI gating and enforce “approved messaging only” draft behavior, without requiring another backend pass to identify misaligned records.
